description:
I run openstack essex on CentOS 6.2. I run keystone, glance-api, glance-registry, nova-api, nova-network, nova-scheduler, nova-cert, nova-objectstore and nova-compute on my control node and only nova-compute on a compute node. 

I set two options below:
resume_guests_state_on_host_boot=True
start_guests_on_host_boot=True
let all instances reboot when nova-compute restart.

But when I kill nova-compute on control node or compute node and restart it, the instances failed to soft reboot. Finally the instances rebooted successfully but why they failed to soft reboot and why there is a error "libvir: QEMU error : Domain not found: no domain with matching name 'instance-0000001d'". the error message is here:



2012-05-27 22:42:33 AUDIT nova.compute.manager [req-06af77be-2ac8-48b5-a689-81ba1cbee140 None None] Rebooting instance 2a416f2c-84fc-49d8-8a57-e3c7ca22f3f3

title: Failed to soft reboot instance when nova-compute restart

comments.content:
I run openstack essex on CentOS 6.2. I run keystone, glance-api, glance-registry, nova-api, nova-network, nova-scheduler, nova-cert, nova-objectstore and nova-compute on my control node and only nova-compute on a compute node. 

I set two options below:
resume_guests_state_on_host_boot=True
start_guests_on_host_boot=True
let all instances reboot when nova-compute restart.

But when I kill nova-compute on control node or compute node and restart it, the instances failed to soft reboot. Finally the instances rebooted successfully but why they failed to soft reboot and why there is a error "libvir: QEMU error : Domain not found: no domain with matching name 'instance-0000001d'". the error message is here:



2012-05-27 22:42:33 AUDIT nova.compute.manager [req-06af77be-2ac8-48b5-a689-81ba1cbee140 None None] Rebooting instance 2a416f2c-84fc-49d8-8a57-e3c7ca22f3f3

Can you try latest stable/essex?
